diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cushing’s syndrome due to a well-differentiated, low-grade thymic neuroendocrine tumor with corticotropin secretion
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Primary aldosteronism, Cushing’s syndrome, ectopic corticotropin secretion
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on the clinical findings of hypertension, hypokalemia, and elevated cortisol levels leading to the discovery of a thymic neuroendocrine tumor causing ectopic corticotropin secretion. Imaging studies, including a PET scan, revealed a nodule in the mediastinum that was subsequently confirmed to be the source of the abnormal hormone production.
